004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.button;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.XboxController;
008import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.event.EventLoop;
009import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.CommandScheduler;
010
011/**
012 * A subclass of {@link XboxController} with {@link Trigger} factories for command-based.
013 *
014 * @see XboxController
015 */
016@SuppressWarnings("MethodName")
017public class CommandXboxController extends XboxController {
018  /**
019   * Construct an instance of a controller.
020   *
021   * @param port The port index on the Driver Station that the controller is plugged into.
022   */
023  public CommandXboxController(int port) {
024    super(port);
025  }
026
027  /**
028   * Constructs an event instance around the left bumper's digital signal.
029   *
030   * @return an event instance representing the left bumper's digital signal attached to the {@link
031   *     CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
032   * @see #leftBumper(EventLoop)
033   */
034  public Trigger leftBumper() {
035    return leftBumper(CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
036  }
037
038  @Override
039  public Trigger leftBumper(EventLoop loop) {
040    return super.leftBumper(loop).castTo(Trigger::new);
041  }
042
043  /**
044   * Constructs an event instance around the right bumper's digital signal.
045   *
046   * @return an event instance representing the right bumper's digital signal attached to the {@link
047   *     CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
048   * @see #rightBumper(EventLoop)
049   */
050  public Trigger rightBumper() {
051    return rightBumper(CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
052  }
053
054  @Override
055  public Trigger rightBumper(EventLoop loop) {
056    return super.rightBumper(loop).castTo(Trigger::new);
057  }
058
059  /**
060   * Constructs an event instance around the left stick button's digital signal.
061   *
062   * @return an event instance representing the left stick button's digital signal attached to the
063   *     {@link CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
064   * @see #leftStick(EventLoop)
065   */
066  public Trigger leftStick() {
067    return leftStick(CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
068  }
069
070  @Override
071  public Trigger leftStick(EventLoop loop) {
072    return super.leftStick(loop).castTo(Trigger::new);
073  }
074
075  /**
076   * Constructs an event instance around the right stick button's digital signal.
077   *
078   * @return an event instance representing the right stick button's digital signal attached to the
079   *     {@link CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
080   * @see #rightStick(EventLoop)
081   */
082  public Trigger rightStick() {
083    return rightStick(CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
084  }
085
086  @Override
087  public Trigger rightStick(EventLoop loop) {
088    return super.rightStick(loop).castTo(Trigger::new);
089  }
090
091  /**
092   * Constructs an event instance around the X button's digital signal.
093   *
094   * @return an event instance representing the X button's digital signal attached to the {@link
095   *     CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
096   * @see #x(EventLoop)
097   */
098  public Trigger x() {
099    return x(CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
100  }
101
102  @Override
103  public Trigger x(EventLoop loop) {
104    return super.x(loop).castTo(Trigger::new);
105  }
106
107  /**
108   * Constructs an event instance around the Y button's digital signal.
109   *
110   * @return an event instance representing the Y button's digital signal attached to the {@link
111   *     CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
112   * @see #y(EventLoop)
113   */
114  public Trigger y() {
115    return y(CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
116  }
117
118  @Override
119  public Trigger y(EventLoop loop) {
120    return super.y(loop).castTo(Trigger::new);
121  }
122
123  /**
124   * Constructs an event instance around the A button's digital signal.
125   *
126   * @return an event instance representing the A button's digital signal attached to the {@link
127   *     CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
128   * @see #a(EventLoop)
129   */
130  public Trigger a() {
131    return a(CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
132  }
133
134  @Override
135  public Trigger a(EventLoop loop) {
136    return super.a(loop).castTo(Trigger::new);
137  }
138
139  /**
140   * Constructs an event instance around the B button's digital signal.
141   *
142   * @return an event instance representing the B button's digital signal attached to the {@link
143   *     CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
144   * @see #b(EventLoop)
145   */
146  public Trigger b() {
147    return b(CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
148  }
149
150  @Override
151  public Trigger b(EventLoop loop) {
152    return super.b(loop).castTo(Trigger::new);
153  }
154
155  /**
156   * Constructs an event instance around the start button's digital signal.
157   *
158   * @return an event instance representing the start button's digital signal attached to the {@link
159   *     CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
160   * @see #start(EventLoop)
161   */
162  public Trigger start() {
163    return start(CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
164  }
165
166  @Override
167  public Trigger start(EventLoop loop) {
168    return super.start(loop).castTo(Trigger::new);
169  }
170
171  /**
172   * Constructs an event instance around the back button's digital signal.
173   *
174   * @return an event instance representing the back button's digital signal attached to the {@link
175   *     CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
176   * @see #back(EventLoop)
177   */
178  public Trigger back() {
179    return back(CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
180  }
181
182  @Override
183  public Trigger back(EventLoop loop) {
184    return super.back(loop).castTo(Trigger::new);
185  }
186}
